meanings.definition: A type of white blood cell involved in the immune response.
meanings.sent1: Basophils help the body fight off infections.
meanings.sent2: Doctors can check the levels of basophils in a blood test.
meanings.sent3: The basophils were like tiny soldiers protecting the body from harm.
meanings.sent4: Her basophils were like vigilant guardians, ready to defend at any sign of danger.
meanings.sent5: The basophils swarmed like an army, ready to battle any invaders.

meanings.definition: Cells that release histamine during allergic reactions.
meanings.sent1: During an allergic reaction, basophils release histamine causing symptoms.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how basophils play a role in allergic responses.
meanings.sent3: The basophils seemed to be having a histamine party, causing chaos in the body.
meanings.sent4: Her basophils were like mischievous troublemakers, stirring up trouble with histamine.
meanings.sent5: The basophils unleashed histamine like a storm, creating a reaction in the body.
